text: Florida Gulf Coast University is a public, coeducational university in Fort Myers, Florida. The university has about 12,024 students. It was founded in 1991. The current president of the university is Wilson G. Bradshaw. ==Sports== The athletics teams of the university are called the Eagles and they have 15 varsity teams. They compete in the Atlantic Sun Conference. ==Other websites== *Florida Gulf Coast University's Official website *FGCU Eagles' Official athletics website Category:Atlantic Sun Conference Category:Colleges and universities in Florida Category:1991 establishments in the United States Category:1990s establishments in Florida
title: Florida Gulf Coast University
